intro: Phacelia linearis, commonly known as slender phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of delicate blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open habitats such as meadows and grasslands. Phacelia linearis is valued for its ornamental appeal and its role in supporting pollinators.
